page.title: 05HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Piersburg Grange in Low Worsall,presently the house of Mr.and Mrs.Tom Kidd,was first used as an inn.In 1732 it was bought by two Piersburg brothers who used it as a trading house.They were declared bankrupt in 1780 and the house fell into ruin until it was bought and used as a farm until approximately 20 years ago when the Kidd family moved in. Today Piersburg Grange is certified as a listed historic building. The present owners who are keenly interested in the history of the house are constantly in search of information. They have restored the ingle-nook fireplace and original door of the inn. The cellar,with its stories of smugglers and evidence of tunnels still has a well with beautiful spring water that remains the same level all year.
